intro: Ficus andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman fig, is a tropical species native to the Andaman Islands. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible figs that are often consumed by local communities. Its leaves are broad, glossy, and have a slightly serrated edge. Ficus andamanica is well adapted to humid, tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soil.
